introduction.para: This document outlines the crew procedure for a pre-ride bicycle check, ensuring rider safety and optimal performance. It details the steps for inspecting critical components and performing necessary adjustments.

step_detail.title: 1. Brakes
step_detail.list_item: Verify cable integrity (no cuts or fraying).
Confirm proper brake function - both front and rear.

step_detail.title: 2. Tires
step_detail.list_item: Tire pressure (see table below for recommended ranges).
Inspect tires for cracks, splits, or embedded objects.

step_detail.title: 3. Wheels
step_detail.list_item: Spin wheels to verify smooth rotation.
Listen for unusual noises indicating bearing issues.
Confirm axle nuts are securely tightened.

step_detail.title: 4. Headset
step_detail.list_item: Ensure headset bearings are tight and smooth.

step_detail.title: 5. Chain
step_detail.list_item: Verify easy movement of chain links.

step_detail.title: 6. Handlebar & Stem
step_detail.para: Do *not* ride with a cracked stem.

step_detail.title: 7. Computer Display
step_detail.para: Ensure the computer is displaying accurate information (example):

notes.para: This procedure is a guideline; adapt it based on specific bicycle types and rider needs.
Regular maintenance and inspection are crucial for safety and performance.
Always prioritize safety; if unsure about any component, seek professional assistance.
